flashcards.english: Mũrango (door), Kabati (cupboard), Metha (table), Nđirica (window), Gĩtĩ (chair), Gaturwa/Njĩngwa (stool)
flashcards.notes: Essential sitting room furniture vocabulary from week 2 greetings lesson

flashcards.english: Bundi (handyman/carpenter/plumber), Mũrĩmi (farmer), Nđereba (driver), Atongoria (leaders), Borithi (police), Mũũbĩa (priest/catholic), Mũhũrĩri wa mbica (photographer), Mũgwĩmi (hunter), Mũrĩithia wa mahiũ (herder of domestic animals), Aturi (iron mongers), Ombi a nyũngũ (potters), Mũgo (medicine person/traditional healer)
flashcards.notes: 12 professions with work descriptions. Pattern: Nđĩ/Wĩ/Nĩ + profession. Example: Nđutaga wĩra wa mbaũ (I work with timber), Arutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria magongona ma kanitha (his work is to lead church services)

flashcards.english: Guoya (scared), Gikeno (happy), Kĩeha (sad), Marakara (angry), Ndũhĩo (excited), Kĩmako (worried), Kũhahũka (surprised), Ũrĩmũ (silly), Kwaga kũiganĩra (frustrated), Kũigua kĩnyiria (to be disgusted), Kũnyĩra (to express disgust)
flashcards.notes: Emotions vocabulary with question pattern: Ũraigua atĩa? (what are you feeling?) → Ndiraguĩra... (I am feeling...). Includes emotional expressions and physical manifestations
